Vite has become the default choice for new React projects, replacing Create React App:

by Andrew Hunt and David Thomas is one of those rare technical books that remains relevant decades after publication. Updated in 2019 for its 20th anniversary, this book distills practical wisdom for software engineers at any career stage.
Craftsmanship and professionalism in software development
Practical techniques for writing better code
"Care about your craft. Think! About your work."
This opening sets the tone for the entire book—programming is a craft that demands thoughtfulness and continuous improvement.

One of the most powerful concepts in the book: don't leave "broken windows" (bad code, poor decisions) unrepaired. Once you allow one broken window, more will follow, and the entire project will deteriorate.
When you encounter bad code, fix it immediately or file a ticket. Don't let it become normalized.

Good design isn't just about aesthetics—it's about creating interfaces that are intuitive, accessible, and delightful to use. Here are the core principles that guide my approach to web interface design.
The primary goal of any interface is to communicate clearly. Users should never have to guess what an element does or where they should click next.
Use descriptive labels instead of clever metaphors
Maintain consistent terminology throughout the interface
Provide clear visual hierarchy with typography and spacing
Show system status and provide feedback for user actions
Don't overwhelm users with every option at once. Reveal complexity gradually as users need it.
Good interfaces work like a conversation—they reveal information at the right pace, neither too much nor too little.
Start with the most common use cases
Use expandable sections for advanced options
Provide defaults that work for most users

Social networks have fundamentally transformed how we communicate, form relationships, and organize society. This exploration examines the structural properties of networks and their profound impact on modern life.
At their core, social networks are patterns of relationships between individuals, groups, or organizations. These connections can represent:
Social networks aren't new—humans have always formed networks. What's changed is:
Digital platforms enable networks of billions
Network structures are now observable and analyzable
We can consciously design and manipulate networks

Rust is a systems programming language that combines low-level control with high-level ergonomics. It guarantees memory safety without a garbage collector, making it ideal for performance-critical applications.

Jekyll is a static site generator that transforms plain text into static websites. Combined with GitHub Pages, it provides a powerful, free hosting solution for blogs and documentation sites.
No database or server-side code to manage
Free hosting with custom domain support
Fast page loads and excellent security
